name: Stratton Mountain Resort

reviews.text: We stayed at the Long Trail House for a long weekend and it was great. It is very quiet this time of year.. the summer season hasnt really started up yet. We went to manchester to shop, eat and go to the top of MT Equinox. The gondola at Stratton wasnt running yet, and the stores were closed.. ghost town! But, the long trail house is a beautiful place, underground garage, very easy to get to, and the room we had was clean and spatious. The pool and hot tub are showing their age. Great view of mtn.
reviews.title: Long Trail House

reviews.text: Our family of four just returned from a Spring break trip to Stratton Mountain. We stayed in the Long Trail house in a one bedroom condo. The room was clean and well equipped. The facility was beautiful and staff helpful and friendly. The location was only a five minute walk to the slopes through the village. A free ski locker was provided in the condo bldg but we opted to pay to leave our skiis slopeside overnight. Although the underground parking lot was nearly full, we never felt that the resort was crowded. We rarely had to wait in a lift line and when we did the staff kept everyone organized and moving. The slopes were in great shape for this late in the season. Our ten year old son declared that he would rather go back to Stratton next year instead of our usual Spring break trip to Disney World. Unfortunately, Spring break usually comes too late in the season for skiing in VT.
reviews.title: Fantastic family ski escape

reviews.title: Long Trail House
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our long weekend at the Long Trail House in Stratton. Check-in went smoothly and we parked in the heated indoor garage which is really convenient and attached to the hotel. You never have to clean off your car and we kept our skis there at night. We stayed in a studio room which was perfect for our needs. The kitchenette was great, although I would recommend bringing your own groceries because the small grocery store in the village is very overpriced. It was very cozy and nicely decorated with an updated but rustic feel. The pull down murphy bed was comfortable too.

I loved the common area with the high ceilings, giant fireplace and leather couches. The heated pool and hot tub were great after a long day of skiing. The location was ideal with a 2 minute walk to the village. There were lots of great restaurants and a really fantastic wine bar that we really enjoyed. There does not seem to be much nightlife, however, which was fine with us because that was not the point of this trip.
reviews.title: Flatun bad service stay away

description: Located in southern Vermont less than three hours from Boston and four from New York City, Stratton means a big mountain resort experience that's close to home. Stratton offers skiing and snowboarding, a variety of lodging options, slopeside Village for shopping and dining, full Sports Center, 27 hole golf course, world class Stratton Golf University. Choose from a selection of lodging options: Inn at Stratton Mountain has 122 guest rooms; Stratton Condominiums range from studio apartments to four bedroom units.
